intro: Microlicia microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaved microlicia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and produces showy, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
